text: I think the history of our firm goes
back a long time we are more than 90
years in existence uh and right right
till the early uh '90s we were
essentially a boutique shop with
specialized in a few areas including
Financial Services we were very well
reputed but and were punching way about
of our weight but we were small in terms
of the size of the
operation uh the main growth has
occurred in the last 15 years and that's
been driven primarily by I think three
factors uh first and foremost the market
grew the Indian economy uh really
started uh globalizing and getting more
liberal from the early 90s after the
policies that the government pursued so
that gave us firstly that large amount
of transaction work uh on the basis of
which you could build a large corporate
firm so the market opened up uh the
second uh important factor was the
availability of high quality
employable uh law graduates from uh
universities that were being set up you
know using a slightly different model uh
the national law schools uh which are
sort of based on uh a sort of a institu
management institutions they changed the
format in terms of legal education so
the availability of high quality law
graduates allowed us to recruit and fuel
this expansion and the third factor
which is sort of more personal to us was
um a more
entrepreneurial uh more Western oriented
management culture uh our Law Firm is
structured very similar to many Western
uh
organizations uh we have formal career
tracks practice groups and we've tried
to use best practice in terms of uh
structuring our organization more
institutionally I think I Inspire trust
and um a lot of the Young Generation has
believed in the vision that I have
spelled out for them I've been very open
in terms of communicating what my vision
for uh the firm as well as the vision
for the Indian legal industry has been
I'm a firm believer that um India's
independent Law Firm sector has got
enormous potential and there are a lot
who believe in that vision and who uh
follow
me I see basically two models of law
firms in the world one of the global law
firms or they go by the name of onstop
shops which will open an office
everywhere they see an opportunity and
will also practice the local law of that
jurisdiction um that's a successful
model as well well but that's not the
only model and the other model is those
of uh independent law firms national
champions like like ourselves which have
some unique strengths as well um and I
think both have their strengths and
weaknesses uh for practicing Cutting
Edge work in a jurisdiction I think the
latter model is infinitely Superior
because you have the best lawyers and
the best expertise that is available
we're seeing also the impact of the
financial crisis for instance on the
former model the former model is driven
largely by following financial sector
client across the world and when the
financial sector itself the leading
Global Banks and investment Banks they
themselves come under pressure the
natural impact on these law firms uh is
also they feel the pain with them as
well and like the banks themselves are
shrinking so are the law firms whereas
firms like uh like ours and in different
uh other jurisdictions they're somewhat
more insulated
there would always be some amount of
nervousness not because we do not
substantively recognize those rights but
enforcement can be uh somewhat slow and
patchy uh but for a diligent uh American
corporation which is willing to pursue
its um uh its intellectual property
rights and protect them India would
still deliver the end product and a
number of Corporations have have
experienced that for instance companies
uh like some of the leading technology
players in the world I don't want to
name them or even uh drug manufacturers
they've had eventually they've been able
to uh to achieve Justice
